channel.title: The right way to get *Xbox Live*
channel.description:
Before we start you WILL need a way to hook your Xbox up to your computer. I use a crossover cable, it cost me about $9 for a 7ft cable at my local computer store, that is the only investment you will have to make. 9$...for a cable. That or figure some other free alternative to connect your Xbox to your computer. Good luck with that. [b]Step 1 Connecting Pc and Xbox[/b] Alright start off by hooking your Xbox up to your computer, if you went and bought a crossover cable, plug one end into the back of your Xbox and the other into your Ethernet port in the back of your computer. [b]Step 2 Setting up Network on Pc[/b] Now we're going to setup your network on your computer. Goto start, then settings, network connection. Right click on Local area Connection, and click Properties [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/lan.jpg[/img] Now scroll down in the little box and select Internet Protocol (TCP/IP) [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/network.jpg[/img] Select properties, set yours up like mine...click ok..then ok again. At this point there should be a delay as the changes are applied. Some computers may have to restart instead. [b]Step3 Setting up Network on Xbox[/b] Fire up the Xbox, go to Settings, Network Settings. [b]*Note [/b] Due to the fact that I have soft-modded my Xbox, I can not give you [i]exact[/i] directions on this part, I can tell you what to set, but you'll have to find it in the Network settings yourself...honestly I think everyone here is capable of that much. This [b]will work on non-modded Xboxs[/b] don't worry. [b]You do not have to soft-mod your Xbox to do this.[/b] Alright. Now I'm going to list what you need to set. Mode: Static IP: 192.168.0.3 Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0 Gateway: 192.168.0.100 DNS is blank Save this and reboot Xbox. [b]Step 4a Setting up Xlink Kai[/b] Yes I know that means this isn't actual Xbox Live, Xlink Kai is exactly like it, and this also works for Ps2, Gamecube, PSP, Xbox360, etc Go to their website: [url=http://www.teamxlink.co.uk/]http://www.teamxlink.co.uk/[/url] Register an "X-Tag" [url=http://www.teamxlink.co.uk/?go=register]http://www.teamxlink.co.uk/?go=register[/url] Then download Xlink Kai to your computer. Install, open, and login yourself in. So now we're looking at this: [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/xlink.jpg[/img] [b]Step 4b Signing on Halo2 via Xlink Kai[/b] Click on the globe this is bringing you into "Arena Mode" Now wait for it to load...then click Xbox Again after it loads click First Person shooter...wait for all the game pictures to load, scroll down and click Halo2 [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/xlink2.jpg[/img] Now click your country. [b]Step 4c Making Sure Everything Works[/b] Now if your Xbox isn't on, turn it on and boot up Halo2, now go back to the computer. Click on the magnifying glass in the top left corner. [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/xlink3.jpg[/img] Make sure that says "Yes" now click on the file icon below the blue help icon. [b]*Note[/b] If it does not say "Yes" and you use a Router, you [b]may[/b] have to Port Forward. From Xlink Kai official site:
You'd be happy to know that nearly all routers will no longer require any port-forwarding for use with XLink Kai. Upon connection, each user is probed for a randomly open port and assigned that port should a connection to the Orbital be successful. However, there will always be a select few people who will have no alternative but to force a port-forward. If Kai reports your network as unreachable, port-forward port 30000 on UDP to the local IP of the PC running Kai. Remember to enter the port number in 'Kai Port' in the Kai Configuration Tool. Leave Kai Deep Port as 0!. If you are behind a network that will not allow you to forward ports, but are allocated a few ports (generally on College campuses for gaming), use whatever port number you have available, as long as it is a UDP port-forward
I can not help anyone here Port Forward as I do not use a router...the best I can do is refer you to this site: [url=http://portforward.com/]http://portforward.com/[/url] If that doesn't work, ask around here or at the Xlink Kai site. [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/xlink4.jpg[/img] That means it has detected your Xbox, if that does not show up, go to System Link in Halo2. If it still does not show up try rebooting the Xbox. Still nothing? Your Xbox isn't hooked up to your computer correctly. Refer to their site for help, or post here. Now if your not in System Link mode in Halo2 already, go there, and games will start appearing in the menu, select and join one. Congratulations. Your playing Xlink Kai. :)

Xbc is free. If you just want the PRO features it costs. Like some of the features are that you can make it automatically kick people for example witha ping over than 100. When I installed XBC I didn’t have to put any static ip’s or change any configs.
[/quote]
Then please tell me how it recognized you had an Xbox…if you didn’t connect it to the computer?

Also I just switched my dashboard over to XBMC. It has Xlink Kai built into it. That tells you something…[/quote]

item.title: The right way to get *Xbox Live*
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

teh spede:

I you want to play Xbox games on multiplayer for free get XBC

Why is Xbox Connect better than Kai, I’ve been told by most Xbox modding communities that Kai is better…I went to the Xbox connect website and they have a total of…55 hosts on…awesome?

From Xbox Connect website

XBC Pro lets you find players near you.
Thats nice, I have to pay $14.95 to find players near me...that doesn't sound free? When in Kai I can get that for free.
S!ms:

Kai, be happy when you can finally play a game…

I’ve been able to play Halo2 every time I tried…? Although I can see what you mean, not many other games have people playing them.

Although thats not Kai’s fault, people will play the games they wanna play…Xbox Connect is the same way, out of the vast amount of 55 hosts -.- about 90% were for Halo2.
You also don’t know how many of those are even for your country…because you have to pay to get that feature.

Read full topic
